identificationModule.briefTitle: Evaluation of Clinical Decision Support System for Scoring of ASPECT Score Using Brain CT Images
identificationModule.officialTitle: An Open Label, Single-center, Retrospective, Pivotal Study to Evaluate the Efficacy of Clinical Decision Support System for Scoring of ASPECT Score Using Brain CT Images

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
cASPECTS is a software that has been pre-learned based on ASPECTS Score of ischemic stroke patients using brain CT images, and clinical decision support system for scoring ASPECTS score by automatically analyzing brain CT images by assisting the medical team.

The specific aims of this study are to evaluate efficacy of cASPECTS for scoring ASPECTS Score compared to the sensitivity and specificity levels of human expert.

armGroups.label: Ischemic stroke positive
armGroups.description: Patients diagnosed with acute ischemic stroke after a brain CT scan

armGroups.label: Ischemic stroke negative with other brain disease
armGroups.description: Patients who has not been diagnosed with acute ischemic stroke after a brain CT scan, but has been diagnosed with other brain diseases.

armGroups.label: Ischemic stroke negative and no brain disease
armGroups.description: Patients who has not been diagnosed with acute ischemic stroke after a brain CT scan and has not been diagnosed with other brain diseases.

interventions.name: cASPECTS
interventions.description: Clinical decision support system for scoring ASPECTS score
armGroupLabels: Ischemic stroke negative and no brain disease
Ischemic stroke negative with other brain disease

primaryOutcomes.measure: Differences between ASPECTS scores in golden standard and in cASPECTS
primaryOutcomes.description: Mean difference between ASPECTS scores calculated by human experts and ASPECTS scores calculated by cASPECTS

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Adults over 19 years old
* Brain CT acquired

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients with ischemic stroke in posterior circulation
* Poor or incomplete brain CT image quality
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: (1) Adults over 19 years old (2) Brain CT acquired are confirmed to be enrolled
